::Terrataur/Aquataur/Pyrotaur/Chaotaur::
    Two ships speed out of the portal near Earth.  The scene was familiar, if 
somewhat smaller.  The ships could, at most, fit three bots in them.  The 
ships opened fire on each other, until one was disabled.

    In the other ship Terrataur looks at the screen apologetically.  Under 
his breath he mutters a matching apology to his commander.  "Why did you have 
to go fiddling with his programming during his last repair job Pyrotaur?"

    Pyrotaur looks up from his station on the bridge and grimaces.  "Hey, 
now, it's not all my fault.  We all agreed that something needed to be done.  
We couldn't have a commander that was paralyzed by fear.  I gave him a little 
bit of aggression."

    Aquataur steps out from the shadows and laughs.  "A little bit of 
aggression?  He's gone nuts, I even hear he changed his name to Chaostaur.  
He blew our comrade nearly to death and you call that 'a little bit of 
aggression'."

    Terrataur steps in between them before they got too angry.  "We both know 
he's alright.  Chaostaur launched him towards here in a stasis pod a long 
time ago.  That's why we're here.  Now Aquataur, start scanning for his 
energy signature."

    She begins scanning the planet from orbit and after a short while shouted 
with joy.  "I've found him.  He's somewhere in the Northwestern part of the 
North American continent.  There seems to be a battle going on, my scans are 
being disrupted by the energy."

    They set the ship down in central Canada and begin walking toward the 
Chivtron base.

    Meanwhile, in the other ship Chaostaur surveys the control panels and 
spotting an overload quickly stuffs himself into an overly large stasis pod.  
The pod launches and crashes down in the strait of Gibraltar, ominously close 
to the Alliance base.  The pod sends the standard distress call.

OOC: Wow, that was surprisingly longwinded of me.
